skill.name: web-research
skill.description: Use this skill for requests related to web research; it provides a structured approach to conducting comprehensive web research
skill.summary: Use this skill for requests related to web research; it provides a structured approach to conducting...
skill.author: langchain-ai

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation with no executable code. It provides instructions for conducting web research using Claude's built-in tools. No security risks identified.

content.value_statement: Research complex topics efficiently without getting overwhelmed. This skill organizes your research into manageable subtopics and synthesizes findings into comprehensive reports.
actual_capabilities: Creates organized research folders and plans
limitations: Requires manual planning before research begins
Limited to 3-5 web searches per subtopic

use_cases.title: Research paper preparation
use_cases.description: Gather comprehensive information on complex topics with proper citations for academic writing

use_cases.title: Market research reports
use_cases.description: Compare competitors, analyze trends, and synthesize market intelligence efficiently

use_cases.title: Topic investigation
use_cases.description: Research background information for articles, videos, or presentations with verified sources

prompt_templates.title: Basic topic research
prompt_templates.prompt: Research the history and current applications of renewable energy in developing countries

prompt_templates.title: Comparative analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare the top 3 project management tools for remote teams, focusing on features and pricing

prompt_templates.title: Complex investigation
prompt_templates.prompt: Investigate the impact of AI on healthcare diagnostics, including benefits, risks, and regulatory challenges

prompt_templates.title: Market research
prompt_templates.prompt: Research the electric vehicle market in Europe, including major players, growth trends, and government policies

output_examples.input: Research the benefits and risks of remote work for software development teams
output: Generated research plan with 4 subtopics: productivity, collaboration, mental health, cost savings
Deployed 3 research subagents to gather findings
Synthesized comprehensive report with 12 sources cited
Key findings: 23% productivity increase, but 31% report isolation issues

best_practices: Always create a research plan before starting to stay organized
Use clear, specific subtopics to avoid overlap between subagents
Review all findings files before creating your final synthesis
anti_patterns: Skipping the planning phase leads to disorganized research
Having subagents return findings directly instead of saving to files
Over-researching with more than 5 searches per subtopic

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Claude versions?
faq.answer: Yes, it works with Claude and Claude Code. The skill uses standard tools available in both platforms.

faq.question: How many subtopics should I create?
faq.answer: Use 1-2 for simple queries, 3 for comparisons, and 3-5 for complex investigations. Avoid overlap between subtopics.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing research workflow?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill creates standard markdown files you can use with any note-taking or documentation system.

faq.question: Is my research data safe?
faq.answer: All files are saved locally in your working directory. No data is sent to external services beyond web searches.

faq.question: What if subagents cannot find enough information?
faq.answer: Review the findings files to identify gaps. You can spawn additional subagents or adjust your search queries.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual web searching?
faq.answer: This skill provides structure and parallelization. You get organized findings files instead of scattered browser tabs.
